items.author: interactive@life.church (Joakim Lundqvist)
items.content:
You can never fully control your circumstances, but you can fully control your attitude. In Week 4 of True Virtue, we’re learning how to keep an attitude of gratitude.

ABOUT THIS MESSAGE

In a cynical world, it’s easy to give the impression of good character without actually living it out. But now more than ever, actions speak louder than words. Not just any action, but the kind centered on what matters most. Let’s learn how we can bring True Virtue back into our everyday lives.

Find Your Fit

Something inside you just might be part of God’s plans to change the world around you. Because of how much we believe this, at Life.Church there are serving opportunities to fit your schedule and your skills! Learn more at http://www.life.church/findmyfit

Learn more about True Virtue: www.life.church/truevirtue

Start the True Virtue Bible Plan: www.go2.lc/truevirtue

WE’RE OPEN

items.content:
Are you thinking about giving up on something important? Don’t quit until you hear Week 3 of True Virtue. It could be exactly what you need to keep going. 

 

ABOUT THIS MESSAGE

In a cynical world, it’s easy to give the impression of good character without actually living it out. But now more than ever, actions speak louder than words. Not just any action, but the kind centered on what matters most. Let’s learn how we can bring True Virtue back into our everyday lives.

 

Find Your Fit

Something inside you just might be part of God’s plans to change the world around you. Because of how much we believe this, at Life.Church there are serving opportunities to fit your schedule and your skills! Learn more at http://www.life.church/findmyfit

 

Learn more about True Virtue: www.life.church/truevirtue

 

Start the True Virtue Bible Plan: www.go2.lc/truevirtue

 

 

WE’RE OPEN

We’re continuing to monitor guidelines and best practices for gathering in a safe way. Learn more about everything we're doing to keep you safe and how you can help by using hand sanitizer, washing your hands often, and more: https://www.life.church/updates  

 

Find a time and attend a service with us: http://www.life.church/locations  

 

NEXT STEPS

Have you made a decision to follow Jesus? You may be wondering what’s next on your journey. We want to help! Let us guide you to your next steps in your walk with Christ: https://www.life.church/next  

 

ABOUT LIFE.CHURCH

Wherever you are in life, you have a purpose. Life.Church wants to help you find your next step. Our hope is that your journey will include joining us at a Life.Church location throughout the United States or globally online at https://www.live.life.church. Find locations, videos, and more info about us at https://www.life.church or download the Life.Church app at https://www.life.church/app.  

 

FIND US ON SOCIAL MEDIA

Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/life.church  

Instagram: http://www.instagram.com/life.church  

Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/lifechurch  

 

CONNECT WITH PASTOR CRAIG

YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCIIdiIO-Y20hRW9niR0CA8A  

Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/craiggroeschel  

Instagram: http://www.instagram.com/craiggroeschel  

Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/craiggroeschel  

 

When You Feel Like Quitting - 00:00

The Virtue Of Perseverance - 5:55

Why Do We Give Up? - 9:12

Perspective Is Often Very Limited - 12:43

Progress Isn’t Always Obvious - 16:35

Where Is God? - 22:31

items.content:
At Life.Church, we like to say, “If we live with integrity, nothing else matters. If we don’t live with integrity, nothing else matters.” But what does that really mean? And how do we live with integrity in all aspects of our lives? Find out in Week 2 of True Virtue. 

ABOUT THIS MESSAGE

In a cynical world, it’s easy to give the impression of good character without actually living it out. But now more than ever, actions speak louder than words. Not just any action, but the kind centered on what matters most. Let’s learn how we can bring True Virtue back into our everyday lives.

Find Your Fit

Something inside you just might be part of God’s plans to change the world around you. Because of how much we believe this, at Life.Church there are serving opportunities to fit your schedule and your skills! Learn more at http://www.life.church/findmyfit

Learn more about True Virtue: www.life.church/truevirtue

Start the True Virtue Bible Plan: www.go2.lc/truevirtue

WE’RE OPEN

We’re continuing to monitor guidelines and best practices for gathering in a safe way. Learn more about everything we're doing to keep you safe and how you can help by using hand sanitizer, washing your hands often, and more: https://www.life.church/updates

Find a time and attend a service with us: http://www.life.church/locations

NEXT STEPS

Have you made a decision to follow Jesus? You may be wondering what’s next on your journey. We want to help! Let us guide you to your next steps in your walk with Christ: https://www.life.church/next

ABOUT LIFE.CHURCH

Wherever you are in life, you have a purpose. Life.Church wants to help you find your next step. Our hope is that your journey will include joining us at a Life.Church location throughout the United States or globally online at https://www.live.life.church. Find locations, videos, and more info about us at https://www.life.church or download the Life.Church app at https://www.life.church/app.

items.content:
Pride is something that most of us struggle with, but it’s not always easy to detect. During Week 5 of Deep Clean, we’re learning more about pride and humility so we can step into who God created us to be.

ABOUT THIS MESSAGE

Sometimes life can leave us feeling like a mess. The kind of mess that’s just too complicated to figure out. But it’s possible to start fresh. To experience life in a new way. Discover how in our new message series, Deep Clean.

Start Your Deep Clean

As we talk through different topics in our current message series, Deep Clean, we want to equip you with tools specific to your personal needs. Visit http://www.life.church/howtoquit and https://www.life.church/mydeepclean to learn more.

Learn more about Deep Clean: www.life.church/deepclean

Start the Deep Clean Bible Plan: http://www.go2.lc/clean

items.content:

ABOUT THIS MESSAGE

Sometimes life can leave us feeling like a mess. The kind of mess that’s just too complicated to figure out. But it’s possible to start fresh. To experience life in a new way. Discover how in our new message series, Deep Clean.

Have you ever done something you’re ashamed of? It can be easy to feel like you’ll never be free from the shame of your past. But it’s possible to get a fresh start. Find out how in this message!
ABOUT THIS MESSAGE
Sometimes life can leave us feeling like a mess. The kind of mess that’s just too complicated to figure out. But it’s possible to start fresh. To experience life in a new way. Discover how in our new message series, Deep Clean.
Start Your Deep Clean
As we talk through different topics in our current message series, Deep Clean, we want to equip you with tools specific to your personal needs. Visit www.life.church/mydeepclean to learn more.
Learn more about Deep Clean: www.life.church/deepclean
Start the Deep Clean Bible Plan: www.go2.lc/clean
WE’RE OPEN
To ensure safety at all of our Life.Church locations, our weekend services have been redesigned to create a sanitary, touchless environment that allows for physical distancing. Learn more about everything we're doing to keep you safe and how you can help by using hand sanitizer, washing your hands often, and more: https://www.life.church/updates
Find a time and attend a service with us: http://www.life.church/locations
NEXT STEPS
Have you made a decision to follow Jesus? You may be wondering what’s next on your journey. We want to help! Let us guide you to your next steps in your walk with Christ: https://www.life.church/next
ABOUT LIFE.CHURCH
Wherever you are in life, you have a purpose. Life.Church wants to help you find your next step. Our hope is that your journey will include joining us at a Life.Church location throughout the United States or globally online at https://www.live.life.church. Find locations, videos, and more info about us at https://www.life.church or download the Life.Church app at https://www.life.church/app.

items.content:
Does money buy happiness? We’ve been told all our lives that it doesn’t. But could the way we steward our finances bring us a joy that will last a lifetime? We think so! Learn more in Week 3 of our series, Keep the Change.

ABOUT THIS MESSAGE

When life’s circumstances force you to rethink your finances, where do you turn for answers? No matter where you are on your financial journey, it’s possible to honor God with your money. Together, let’s learn what the Bible says about finances and gain some practical tools that will give us the freedom to say, “Keep the Change!” 

Learn more about Keep the Change: life.church/keepthechange

Start the Keep the Change Bible Plan: www.go2.lc/change

WE’RE OPEN

To ensure safety at all of our Life.Church locations, our weekend services have been redesigned to create a sanitary, touchless environment that allows for physical distancing. Learn more about everything we're doing to keep you safe and how you can help by using hand sanitizer, washing your hands often, and more: https://www.life.church/updates

Find a time and attend a service with us: http://www.life.church/locations

NEXT STEPS

Have you made a decision to follow Jesus? You may be wondering what’s next on your journey. We want to help! Let us guide you to your next steps in your walk with Christ: https://www.life.church/next

ABOUT LIFE.CHURCH

Wherever you are in life, you have a purpose. Life.Church wants to help you find your next step. Our hope is that your journey will include joining us at a Life.Church location throughout the United States or globally online at https://www.live.life.church. Find locations, videos, and more info about us at https://www.life.church or download the Life.Church app at https://www.life.church/app.

When life’s circumstances force you to rethink your finances, where do you turn for answers? No matter where you are on your financial journey, it’s possible to honor God with your money. Together, let’s learn what the Bible says about finances and gain some practical tools that will give us the freedom to say, “Keep the Change!” 
Learn more about Keep the Change: life.church/keepthechange
Start the Keep the Change Bible Plan: www.go2.lc/change
WE’RE OPEN
To ensure safety at all of our Life.Church locations, our weekend services have been redesigned to create a sanitary, touchless environment that allows for physical distancing. Learn more about everything we're doing to keep you safe and how you can help by using hand sanitizer, washing your hands often, and more: https://www.life.church/updates
Find a time and attend a service with us: http://www.life.church/locations
NEXT STEPS
Have you made a decision to follow Jesus? You may be wondering what’s next on your journey. We want to help! Let us guide you to your next steps in your walk with Christ: https://www.life.church/next
ABOUT LIFE.CHURCH
Wherever you are in life, you have a purpose. Life.Church wants to help you find your next step. Our hope is that your journey will include joining us at a Life.Church location throughout the United States or globally online at https://www.live.life.church. Find locations, videos, and more info about us at https://www.life.church or download the Life.Church app at https://www.life.church/app.

items.content:
Our thoughts are powerful. They change our perspective, impact our decisions, and influence our habits. But what do we do when we become trapped by our thoughts, unable to escape negative and unhealthy thinking? Let’s learn what it means to take our thoughts captive and win the war in our minds.

Learn more about Winning the War in Your Mind: https://www.life.church/media/winning-the-war-in-your-mind/

Start the Winning the War in Your Mind Bible Plan: www.go2.lc/war

WE’RE OPEN

To ensure safety at all of our Life.Church locations, our weekend services have been redesigned to create a sanitary, touchless environment that allows for physical distancing. items.title: Defeat Your Negative Thoughts

EVENT: the War in Your Mind Bible Plan

items.author: interactive@life.church (Craig Groeschel)
items.content:
Sometimes no matter what we do, we make the wrong decision. It’s as though we have the wires crossed in our minds. The truth is, our lives are always moving in the direction of our strongest thoughts. So how do you change your thinking so you can change your life? Join us this week for Week 2 of Winning the War in Your Mind to find out! 

Sometimes no matter what we do, we make the wrong decision. It’s as though we have the wires crossed in our minds. The truth is, our lives are always moving in the direction of our strongest thoughts. So how do you change your thinking so you can change your life? Join us this week for Week 2 of Winning the War in Your Mind to find out! 

ABOUT THIS MESSAGE

Our thoughts are powerful. They change our perspective, impact our decisions, and influence our habits. But what do we do when we become trapped by our thoughts, unable to escape negative and unhealthy thinking? Let’s learn what it means to take our thoughts captive and win the war in our minds.

Learn more about Winning the War in Your Mind: https://www.life.church/media/winning-the-war-in-your-mind/

Start the Winning the War in Your Mind Bible Plan: www.go2.lc/war

Learn more about everything we're doing to keep you safe and how you can help by using hand sanitizer, washing your hands often, and more: https://www.life.church/updates

items.contentSnippet:
Sometimes no matter what we do, we make the wrong decision. It’s as though we have the wires crossed in our minds. The truth is, our lives are always moving in the direction of our strongest thoughts. So how do you change your thinking so you can change your life? Join us this week for Week 2 of Winning the War in Your Mind to find out!

items.title: Take Your Mind Back

EVENT: the War in Your Mind Bible Plan

items.author: interactive@life.church (Craig Groeschel)
items.content:
We’ve all tried to think our way out of bad habits and unhealthy thought patterns, only to find ourselves stuck with an out-of-control mind and off-track daily life. But God has something better for your life than your old ways of thinking. It’s time to decide to change your thinking so God can change your life. 

Learn more about Winning the War in Your Mind: https://www.life.church/media/winning-the-war-in-your-mind/

Start The Grudge Bible Plan: www.go2.lc/war

items.title: Winning the War in Your Mind

items.author: interactive@life.church (Craig Groeschel)
items.content:
In this special episode, we get to sit down with Pastor Craig and talk about his new book and upcoming message series. In fact, this episode is the first part in the Winning the War in Your Mind miniseries from Pastor Craig, where we’ll discover how to change our thinking so that we can change our lives. The rest of the miniseries will be available exclusively on the You’ve Heard It Said podcast—Life.Church’s spiritual growth podcast for LifeGroups. Go to http://life.church/YHIS to subscribe on your favorite podcast platform.

ABOUT YOU'VE HEARD IT SAID

Want more meaningful conversations? We started this story-driven podcast to help LifeGroups and friends reclaim their time together. Listen before meeting, then do the important stuff together—talking about the episodes, praying, and making memories.

Join us for honest discussions about the things that matter to you, the struggles you’re facing, and the spiritual truths that can guide you to a deeper understanding of who God made you to be. 
Go to http://life.church/YHIS to subscribe on your favorite podcast platform.

WE’RE OPEN

To ensure safety at all of our Life.Church locations, our weekend services have been redesigned to create a sanitary, touchless environment that allows for physical distancing. Learn more about everything we're doing to keep you safe and how you can help by using hand sanitizer, washing your hands often, and more: https://www.life.church/updates

Find a time and attend a service with us: http://www.life.church/locations

NEXT STEPS

Have you made a decision to follow Jesus? You may be wondering what’s next on your journey. We want to help! Let us guide you to your next steps in your walk with Christ: https://www.life.church/next

items.title: Bonus! Pastor Craig Opens Up About How He Wins the War in His Mind

WORK_OF_ART: the Winning the War in Your Mind

items.author: interactive@life.church (Sermon)
items.content:
Forgiving others is hard, but self-forgiveness can be even harder. God wants you to step out of the shame that holds you back and into the freedom He has for you. Join Pastor Craig Groeschel to see what can change when you choose to forgive yourself.

ABOUT THIS MESSAGE

This week, we’re taking a look back at a message we think is just as impactful today as it was nearly two years ago. Check out the video for more!

Learn more about The Grudge: https://www.life.church/greaterreward

Start The Grudge Bible Plan: www.go2.lc/grudge

itunes.author: Craig Groeschel
itunes.subtitle: Do you ever look at someone successful and wonder how they did it? Often, we’re tempted to think they just got lucky. But it’s not luck that determines the direction of our lives. It's the result of countless consistent, seemingly small decisions done over time. Don’t give up if it’s taking you longer than you thought to reach your goals. Join us for Week 3 of our message series, Greater Reward, to learn how to make decisions today that will give you the life God wants you to have.
itunes.summary: Do you ever look at someone successful and wonder how they did it? Often, we’re tempted to think they just got lucky. But it’s not luck that determines the direction of our lives. It's the result of countless consistent, seemingly small decisions done over time. Don’t give up if it’s taking you longer than you thought to reach your goals. Join us for Week 3 of our message series, Greater Reward, to learn how to make decisions today that will give you the life God wants you to have.

itunes.keywords: trying to change my life, change your life, changing, trying to change your life, trying to change, trying to change me, change, commitment, i can't change how i'm living, why can't i change, commitment to change, i can't change
itunes.subtitle: Do you ever wonder why you are trying to change, but can’t seem to make any real differences in your life? Whether it’s your marriage, faith, health, or something else entirely, maybe you haven’t been able to change because you’ve been trying too hard. Maybe it’s time to start training. Join us for week 2 of our message series, Greater Reward, to learn how to stop trying and start training.
itunes.summary: Do you ever wonder why you are trying to change, but can’t seem to make any real differences in your life? Whether it’s your marriage, faith, health, or something else entirely, maybe you haven’t been able to change because you’ve been trying too hard. Maybe it’s time to start training. Join us for week 2 of our message series, Greater Reward, to learn how to stop trying and start training.

items.title: Why Can’t I Change? - Greater Reward Part 2

items.author: interactive@life.church (Sermon)
items.content:
Society often tells us that if we want something, we should be able to have it RIGHT NOW. But that’s not the way life usually works. Often, when we want something, we have to create and maintain the discipline to reach our goals. In week one of Greater Reward, we’ll learn how to build self-discipline to choose what we want most instead of what we want now.

ABOUT GREATER REWARD

Now more than ever, we need a fresh start.

You could do what you’ve always done. Choose what you want now over what you want most. But there’s a Greater Reward waiting for you. Discover how to let go of the status quo and stay focused on who God says you are and what He wants for your life.

Learn more about Greater Reward: https://www.life.church/greaterreward

Start the Greater Reward Bible Plan: www.go2.lc/reward

WE’RE OPEN

To ensure safety at all of our Life.Church locations, our weekend services have been redesigned to create a sanitary, touchless environment that allows for physical distancing. Learn more about everything we're doing to keep you safe and how you can help by using hand sanitizer, washing your hands often, and more: https://www.life.church/updates

Find a time and attend a service with us: http://www.life.church/locations

NEXT STEPS

Have you made a decision to follow Jesus? You may be wondering what’s next on your journey. We want to help! Let us guide you to your next steps in your walk with Christ: https://www.life.church/next

ABOUT LIFE.CHURCH

Wherever you are in life, you have a purpose. Life.Church wants to help you find your next step. Our hope is that your journey will include joining us at a Life.Church location throughout the United States or globally online at https://www.live.life.church. You could do what you’ve always done. Choose what you want now over what you want most. But there’s a Greater Reward waiting for you. Discover how to let go of the status quo and stay focused on who God says you are and what He wants for your life.
Learn more about Greater Reward: https://www.life.church/greaterreward

items.contentSnippet:
Society often tells us that if we want something, we should be able to have it RIGHT NOW. But that’s not the way life usually works. Often, when we want something, we have to create and maintain the discipline to reach our goals. In week one of Greater Reward, we’ll learn how to build self-discipline to choose what we want most instead of what we want now.

items.author: interactive@life.church (Craig Groeschel)
items.content:
25 years ago, Pastor Craig Groeschel and his wife Amy launched Life.Church in a two-car garage in Edmond, Oklahoma. In the last two and a half decades, we’ve seen God do more than we could ask, think, or imagine through you—the people of this church. This entire weekend will be a celebration of all God has done through Life.Church in the past 25 years - and what He promises to do in the years to come.

WE’RE OPEN

To ensure safety at all of our Life.Church locations, our weekend services have been redesigned to create a sanitary, touchless environment that allows for physical distancing. Learn more about everything we're doing to keep you safe and how you can help by using hand sanitizer, washing your hands often, and more: https://www.life.church/updates

Find a time and attend a service with us: http://www.life.church/locations

NEXT STEPS

Have you made a decision to follow Jesus? You may be wondering what’s next on your journey. We want to help! Let us guide you to your next steps in your walk with Christ: https://www.life.church/next

ABOUT LIFE.CHURCH

Wherever you are in life, you have a purpose. Life.Church wants to help you find your next step. Our hope is that your journey will include joining us at a Life.Church location throughout the United States or globally online at https://www.live.life.church. Find locations, videos, and more info about us at https://www.life.church or download the Life.Church app at https://www.life.church/app.

items.title: 3 Promises for 2021

DATE: the last two and a half decades

items.author: interactive@life.church (Joakim Lundqvist)
items.content:
God has big plans for you. He plants big dreams in your heart—and they can bloom when the soil is fertile. Set your sights on what’s ahead and prepare your soul to chase new hopes and goals as we enter this year together. Join Pastor Joakim Lundqvist for a special message as we kick off 2021 focused on God’s big dreams for our lives.

WELCOME PASTOR JOAKIM LUNDQVIST

Pastor Joakim Lundqvist is Senior Pastor of Word of Life Church in Uppsala, Sweden, with 3,200 members and an international network including over 700 churches. Before stepping into the ministry of Senior Pastor at Word of Life, Pastor Joakim founded the Christian cross-denominational student organization New Generation in Sweden. His 30 years of experience in youth ministry shines through in his creative sermons, aiming to relate to every generation. 

He is married to Maria, who serves as Music Director at Word of Life, and they have two daughters, Evelina and Julia, who are also both involved in the church and ministry.

 

CONNECT WITH PASTOR JOAKIM

Instagram: http://www.instagram.com/joakiml  

Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/joakim.lundqvist  

Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/joakimlundqvist

WE’RE OPEN

To ensure safety at all of our Life.Church locations, our weekend services have been redesigned to create a sanitary, touchless environment that allows for physical distancing. Learn more about everything we're doing to keep you safe and how you can help by using hand sanitizer, washing your hands often, and more: https://www.life.church/updates

Find a time and attend a service with us: http://www.life.church/locations

NEXT STEPS

Have you made a decision to follow Jesus? You may be wondering what’s next on your journey. We want to help! Let us guide you to your next steps in your walk with Christ: https://www.life.church/next

ABOUT LIFE.CHURCH

Wherever you are in life, you have a purpose. Life.Church wants to help you find your next step. Our hope is that your journey will include joining us at a Life.Church location throughout the United States or globally online at https://www.live.life.church. Find locations, videos, and more info about us at https://www.life.church or download the Life.Church app at https://www.life.church/app.

itunes.author: Craig Groeschel
itunes.keywords: peace in christ, dealing with disappointment sermon, angry at god, disappointed, dealing with disappointment, why god, how to handle disappointment, how to deal with disappointment, disappointments, disappointment, can a christian feel disappointed with god, disappointed in god, disappointed by god
itunes.subtitle: Have you ever felt angry at God? Like His plans don’t match yours—or like He doesn’t even have a plan for you at all? Sometimes God interrupts our plans for His purpose. Join Pastor Craig Groeschel for this special Christmas message and see how our disappointments might actually be divine appointments from God.
itunes.summary: Have you ever felt angry at God? Like His plans don’t match yours—or like He doesn’t even have a plan for you at all? Sometimes God interrupts our plans for His purpose. Join Pastor Craig Groeschel for this special Christmas message and see how our disappointments might actually be divine appointments from God.

itunes.keywords: patience, how to have patience, how to have patience in life, god’s timing is perfect, gods timing always right, gods timing always right, practice patience, waiting on god, god’s timing sermon, tell me why i’m waiting, wait on the lord, waiting on god sermon, waiting, waiting on god’s timing
itunes.subtitle: Have you ever felt like you’re waiting on God? His timing might always be perfect, but from where we sit, it can also be frustrating. It can even feel like sometimes, He’s forgotten us. In this message, Pastor Craig Groeschel will take a look at what happens when God’s timing makes us pause, reflect, and depend on Him.
itunes.summary: Have you ever felt like you’re waiting on God? His timing might always be perfect, but from where we sit, it can also be frustrating. It can even feel like sometimes, He’s forgotten us. In this message, Pastor Craig Groeschel will take a look at what happens when God’s timing makes us pause, reflect, and depend on Him.

items.title: Why is God Making Me Wait? - Missing Peace Part 3

items.author: interactive@life.church (Craig Groeschel)
items.content:
Have you ever wished there was a manual for how to deal with difficult people? Jesus didn’t call us to be right, He called us to be loving. He called us to forgive. So while it’s easy to be offended by what we see in the world, we’re called to forgive. Join Pastor Craig Groeschel for a lesson in how to deal with difficult people in this message.

items.contentSnippet:
Have you ever wished there was a manual for how to deal with difficult people? Jesus didn’t call us to be right, He called us to be loving. He called us to forgive. So while it’s easy to be offended by what we see in the world, we’re called to forgive. Join Pastor Craig Groeschel for a lesson in how to deal with difficult people in this message.

items.title: Is Peace Even Possible in 2020? - Missing Peace Part 1

items.author: interactive@life.church (Craig Groeschel)
items.content:

items.title: Does What I Do Matter?

items.author: interactive@life.church (worst year, stand firm, rise up, rejoice through pain, pain, uncertainty, Amy Groeschel, dealing with uncertainty, 2020 year, amy groeschel, faith, 2020 worst year ever, how to deal with uncertainty, rejoice, 2020, 2020 worst year)
items.content:
Alongside her husband Craig, Amy Groeschel co-founded Life.Church in 1996. As the leader of Sisters, the Life.Church women’s ministry, she authors Bible studies for women, including The Call, The Pursuit, and The Hope. She is also the founder and President of Branch15, a non-profit housing ministry supporting women on the path to recovery. Amy and Craig married in 1991 and have six children.

Connect with Pastor Amy on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/amygroeschel

Start the Rise Up and Stand Firm Bible Plan: https://www.go2.lc/riseup  

Get more from Sisters: https://www.life.church/sisters

WE’RE OPEN

To ensure safety at all of our Life.Church locations, our weekend services have been redesigned to create a sanitary, touchless environment that allows for physical distancing. Learn more about everything we're doing to keep you safe and how you can help by using hand sanitizer, washing your hands often, and more: https://www.life.church/updates

Find a time and attend a service with us: http://www.life.church/locations

NEXT STEPS

items.contentSnippet:
Alongside her husband Craig, Amy Groeschel co-founded Life.Church in 1996. As the leader of Sisters, the Life.Church women’s ministry, she authors Bible studies for women, including The Call, The Pursuit, and The Hope. She is also the founder and President of Branch15, a non-profit housing ministry supporting women on the path to recovery. Amy and Craig married in 1991 and have six children.
Connect with Pastor Amy on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/amygroeschel
Start the Rise Up and Stand Firm Bible Plan: https://www.go2.lc/riseup  
Get more from Sisters: https://www.life.church/sisters

itunes.subtitle: Sometimes, it’s hard to have faith, because the reality is this: life is unpredictable. But you were made to persevere, no matter the highs and lows. Join Pastor Amy Groeschel for this week’s message of hope and faith, and find out how to stand firm and rejoice through pain and uncertainty.

items.content:

You can find hope. You can trust in the One who holds the future in His hands. Learn more about In God We Trust: https://www.life.church/ingodwetrust

itunes.keywords: faith, the truth will set you free, christians, christianity, grace, grace saves, church, john chapter 1, what is grace in the bible, religion, in god we trust, john 1, truth, saved by grace
itunes.subtitle: Grace and truth are the cornerstones of the Gospel and Christianity. But here’s some truth: Sometimes, Christians get it wrong. And here’s some grace: Falling short is okay when you know the Savior. Join Pastor Craig Groeschel to discover why Christians can get it wrong, and what we can do to embrace the grace and truth that Christ offers to us.
itunes.summary: Grace and truth are the cornerstones of the Gospel and Christianity. But here’s some truth: Sometimes, Christians get it wrong. And here’s some grace: Falling short is okay when you know the Savior. Join Pastor Craig Groeschel to discover why Christians can get it wrong, and what we can do to embrace the grace and truth that Christ offers to us.

itunes.subtitle: Need some good news? In times of trouble God overflows with His exceedingly abundant protection, provision, and strength. Our God is big enough to oversee the whole world and loving enough to care about you. Be still and know that He is God. Take heart in this message of good news from Pastor Craig Groeschel.

Our God is big enough to oversee the whole world and loving enough to care about you. Be still and know that He is God. Take heart in this message of good news from Pastor Craig Groeschel.

itunes.author: Craig Groeschel
itunes.subtitle: Are you under the influence of God or culture? When we lower our guard, it’s hard to know what’s influencing us—but whatever we allow to influence us, changes us. In this message, Pastor Craig Groeschel uses the biblical story of Daniel to illustrate how to stay under God’s influence when the world offers tempting alternatives to His righteousness.

items.title: Under the Influence: In God We Trust Part 2

items.author: interactive@life.church (Craig Groeschel)
items.content:
It’s hard to trust God when you don’t understand the plan, and even harder to surrender when you’re longing for control. But in the midst of the chaos, there’s a hope you can cling to. In this message, Pastor Craig Groeschel shares two prayers you can pray that will help you build your obedience to trust God and to surrender to Him what you cannot control.

ABOUT IN GOD WE TRUST

Pandemics. Politics. Social unrest. There’s no denying we’re in a season of conflict and chaos—but the noise in your news feed doesn’t have to pollute your soul. You can find peace. You can find hope. You can trust in the One who holds the future in His hands. Learn more about In God We Trust: https://www.life.church/ingodwetrust

Start the In God We Trust Bible Plan: https://www.go2.lc/trust

WE’RE OPEN

To ensure safety at all of our Life.Church locations, our weekend services have been redesigned to create a sanitary, touchless environment that allows for physical distancing. Learn more about everything we're doing to keep you safe and how you can help by using hand sanitizer, washing your hands often, and more: https://www.life.church/updates

Find a time and attend a service with us: http://www.life.church/locations

NEXT STEPS

Have you made a decision to follow Jesus? You may be wondering what’s next on your journey. We want to help! Let us guide you to your next steps in your walk with Christ: https://www.life.church/next

ABOUT LIFE.CHURCH

Wherever you are in life, you have a purpose. Life.Church wants to help you find your next step. Our hope is that your journey will include joining us at a Life.Church location throughout the United States or globally online at https://www.live.life.church. Find locations, videos, and more info about us at https://www.life.church or download the Life.Church app at https://www.life.church/app.

items.title: Can You Trust God? In God We Trust Part 1

items.author: interactive@life.church (Sermon)
items.content:
WELCOME PASTOR JOAKIM LUNDQVIST

Pastor Joakim Lundqvist is Senior Pastor of Word of Life Church in Uppsala, Sweden, with 3,200 members and an international network including over 700 churches. Before stepping into the ministry of Senior Pastor at Word of Life, Pastor Joakim founded the Christian cross-denominational student organization New Generation in Sweden. His 30 years of experience in youth ministry shines through in his creative sermons, aiming to relate to every generation. 

He is married to Maria, who serves as Music Director at Word of Life, and they have two daughters, Evelina and Julia, who are also both involved in the church and ministry.

 

CONNECT WITH PASTOR JOAKIM

Instagram: http://www.instagram.com/joakiml  

Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/joakim.lundqvist  

Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/joakimlundqvist  

ABOUT 21st CENTURY TEMPLES

Miracles beyond belief, truth pushing back fear and lies, answered prayers: They don’t just belong in stories from the past. They’re happening today—and they can happen through you, too. Learn more about this series: https://www.life.church/temples

LIFE.CHURCH LOCATIONS ARE OPEN

To ensure safety at all of our Life.Church locations, our weekend services have been redesigned to create a sanitary, touchless environment that allows for physical distancing. Learn more about everything we're doing to keep you safe and how you can help by using hand sanitizer, washing your hands often, and more:: https://www.life.church/updates

NEXT STEPS

Have you made a decision to follow Jesus? You may be wondering what’s next on your journey. We want to help! Let us guide you to your next steps in your walk with Christ: https://www.life.church/next

ABOUT LIFE.CHURCH

Wherever you are in life, you have a purpose. Life.Church wants to help you find your next step. Our hope is that your journey will include joining us at a Life.Church location throughout the United States or globally online at https://www.live.life.church. Find locations, videos, and more info about us at https://www.life.church or download the Life.Church app at https://www.life.church/app.

itunes.subtitle: Miracles happen every day—and they can happen through you. Join Pastor Joakim Lundqvist to find out why you are a modern-day temple and a vessel of God’s holiness, and how He can use you to do incredible miracles, not only in your own life, but in the lives of others.

items.contentSnippet:
WELCOME PASTOR JOAKIM LUNDQVIST
Pastor Joakim Lundqvist is Senior Pastor of Word of Life Church in Uppsala, Sweden, with 3,200 members and an international network including over 700 churches. Before stepping into the ministry of Senior Pastor at Word of Life, Pastor Joakim founded the Christian cross-denominational student organization New Generation in Sweden. His 30 years of experience in youth ministry shines through in his creative sermons, aiming to relate to every generation. 
He is married to Maria, who serves as Music Director at Word of Life, and they have two daughters, Evelina and Julia, who are also both involved in the church and ministry.
 
CONNECT WITH PASTOR JOAKIM
Instagram: http://www.instagram.com/joakiml  
Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/joakim.lundqvist  
Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/joakimlundqvist  
ABOUT 21st CENTURY TEMPLES
Miracles beyond belief, truth pushing back fear and lies, answered prayers: They don’t just belong in stories from the past. They’re happening today—and they can happen through you, too. Learn more about this series: https://www.life.church/temples
LIFE.CHURCH LOCATIONS ARE OPEN

itunes.subtitle: Take a fresh look at our favorite message series from the last few years at Life.Church with The Best Of! In this message from the Anxious for Nothing series, learn from the biblical figure Elijah how to avoid running yourself into the ground, shutting people out, focusing on the negative, and forgetting God in your anxiety. God speaks in the whispers: don’t be anxious for nothing when you’ve had enough!

items.title: The Best of Life.Church: Part 1

items.author: interactive@life.church (Craig Groeschel)
items.content:
ABOUT EMOTIONS

Joy. Sadness. Anger. Compassion. Emotions are electric. God has given each of us the capacity to feel deeply. And when we can better process our powerful emotions, we can start to understand how He will use them for His good. Learn more about the Emotions message series: https://www.life.church/emotions  

REOPENING

To ensure safety at all of our Life.Church locations, our weekend services have been redesigned to create a sanitary, touchless environment that allows for physical distancing. Learn more about everything we're doing to keep you safe and how you can help by using hand sanitizer, washing your hands often, and more:: https://www.life.church/updates

NEXT STEPS

Have you made a decision to follow Jesus? You may be wondering what’s next on your journey. We want to help! Let us guide you to your next steps in your walk with Christ: https://www.life.church/next

ABOUT LIFE.CHURCH

Wherever you are in life, you have a purpose. Life.Church wants to help you find your next step. Our hope is that your journey will include joining us at a Life.Church location throughout the United States or globally online at https://www.live.life.church. Find locations, videos, and more info about us at https://www.life.church or download the Life.Church app at https://www.life.church/app.

itunes.author: Craig Groeschel
itunes.keywords: emotions, overcome sadness, emotion, feeling sad, sad for no reason, joy, sadness, sad, feelings, why am i sad for no reason, experience true joy, joyful, emotional, feeling sad for no reason, how to deal with sadness
itunes.subtitle: Jesus felt sadness—and he feels the sadness so many of us are feeling in the world right now. There’s one thing that brings Jesus sadness more than anything else, and it’s the same thing that keeps us from experiencing His joy. In this message, you’ll hear three ways you can experience joy with Jesus, and why it’s so much better being joyful together than feeling sadness alone.

itunes.keywords: emotions, dealing with anger, angry, sin, controlling anger, feeling angry, mad, injustices, jesus got angry, jacob blake, injustice, injustice, angry like jesus, how to control anger, anger, how to deal with anger, feelings, control anger, emotional, jesus
itunes.subtitle: Jesus felt many emotions—and anger was one of them. But there are a few things we can learn about why Jesus got angry, and what He chose to do when He felt strong emotions. Join Pastor Craig Groeschel for a message about how when we focus our anger on the right things and channel our emotions the right way, we can start to unite a divided world.

itunes.keywords: emotions, anxiety, stress, reduce anxiety, relieve anxiety, stress relief, anxiety relief, managing anxiety, how to deal with anxiety, relieve stress, get rid of anxiety, dealing with anxiety, control anxiety, how to reduce anxiety, how to get rid of anxiety, stop anxiety
itunes.subtitle: Jesus Himself needed anxiety relief. And when He despaired, He gave us the blueprint for how to deal with worry, stress, and fear. If you need anxiety relief, join Pastor Craig Groeschel and discover the three things Jesus leads us to do to find peace in our hearts and align the feelings we experience with a faith that never fails.

itunes.author: Craig Groeschel
itunes.keywords: grief, hurt, hurt feelings, emotions, how are you, grieving, emotion, feeling, feelings, how are you doing, pain, struggle, compassion
itunes.subtitle: When you’re grieving, when you’ve got hurt feelings, when you’re struggling, remember—Jesus hurt the same way you do. And He feels compassion for people who hurt. In this message, Pastor Craig Groeschel speaks to anyone feeling unsettled, depressed, anxious, or hopeless with a simple reminder: God sees you. Cast your hopes, your cares, and your hurt feelings on Him. He cares for you.
itunes.summary: When you’re grieving, when you’ve got hurt feelings, when you’re struggling, remember—Jesus hurt the same way you do. And He feels compassion for people who hurt. In this message, Pastor Craig Groeschel speaks to anyone feeling unsettled, depressed, anxious, or hopeless with a simple reminder: God sees you. Cast your hopes, your cares, and your hurt feelings on Him. He cares for you.

itunes.subtitle: Have you ever wished you knew what to do when you feel hopeless? If you feel disconnected, hopeless, or you just know something is missing—it's not the end of your story. It's an opportunity to reconnect. To find hope. And to rediscover what you lost. Don’t miss out on this special message with Pastor Craig Groeschel.

items.title: What Your Life is Missing

items.author: interactive@life.church (Robert Madu)
items.content:
ABOUT PASTOR ROBERT MADU

Robert is passionately in love with Jesus. For 10 years he has crisscrossed the globe, preaching the Gospel and taking every opportunity to tell people about the love of Jesus Christ. Robert is compelled to make aware to every individual that God is for them and that He has a specific plan and purpose for every life. Robert serves on the teaching team at Trinity Church in Cedar Hill, TX. He and his wife Taylor have three children.

CONNECT WITH PASTOR ROBERT

Web: https://robertmadu.com/

Instagram: http://www.instagram.com/robertmadu

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/robert.madu

Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/robertmadu

ABOUT DON’T FORGET TO REMEMBER

Uncertainty can drive you to fear, worry, and doubt. But it’s also an invitation to hope. When you’re faced with something you can’t handle on your own, Don’t Forget to Remember who worked miracles in the past—and that He can do it again. Learn more about the Don’t Forget to Remember message series: https://www.life.church/dontforget  

REOPENING

To ensure safety at all of our Life.Church locations, our weekend services have been redesigned to create a sanitary, touchless environment that allows for physical distancing. Learn more about everything we're doing to keep you safe and how you can help by using hand sanitizer, washing your hands often, and more:: https://www.life.church/updates

itunes.keywords: overwhelmed, robert madu 2020, robert madu sermons, don’t forget to remember, robert madu sermons 2020, jesus miracles, miracles, robert madu, miracle, pastor robert madu, feeling overwhelmed
itunes.subtitle: If you’re feeling overwhelmed, you’re not alone. Jesus worked many miracles in the Bible—and yet his disciples still sometimes doubted Him. Don’t forget to remember His power when you’re feeling overwhelmed! If you’re ready to stop worrying and start relying on God’s power in your own life, join Pastor Robert Madu for a message on compassion, action, and how to remember that God is always in control.

items.content:
ABOUT CALLED

Your life has meaning. Maybe you haven’t discovered your passion yet. Maybe you knew your calling once, but it’s gone now. Or maybe, you just need a reminder of what your purpose truly is. There’s no denying it: You’re Called. The only question is, are you ready to answer? Learn more about the Called message series: https://www.life.church/called

REOPENING

To ensure safety at all of our Life.Church locations, our weekend services have been redesigned to create a sanitary, touchless environment that allows for physical distancing. itunes.author: Craig Groeschel
itunes.keywords: how to find your calling, how to find your purpose in life, life.church, what am i called to do, reclaim your calling, why am i here, craig groeschel, what is my calling from god, what is my purpose, i am called, find your purpose, god’s calling, calling, reclaim my life, chosen, how to find your purpose, how to know your calling in life, called, life purpose
itunes.subtitle: Wondering how to find your purpose? It's not always easy, and when you find it, it will probably be even tougher to live it out. The moment you step into your calling, you step out of your comfort zone. But when you're called to a purpose, backing down isn't an option. Join Pastor Craig Groeschel to discover how reclaiming your calling may come at a cost—but it will also sustain you in the long run.

items.contentSnippet:
ABOUT CALLED
Your life has meaning. Maybe you haven’t discovered your passion yet. Maybe you knew your calling once, but it’s gone now. Or maybe, you just need a reminder of what your purpose truly is. There’s no denying it: You’re Called. The only question is, are you ready to answer? Learn more about the Called message series: https://www.life.church/called

itunes.keywords: how to find your calling, you are chosen, called by god, find my calling, voice of god, the call of god sermon, god's calling on your life, call of god, god’s calling sermon, hearing god’s voice, god’s calling you, how to hear god’s voice, hear the call of god, god’s calling, calling, is god calling you, listen to god's voice, called
itunes.subtitle: When you think about your calling, you might think about what you’re called by God to do. But your purpose isn’t as much about what you’re doing as it is who you’re becoming. Being called by God means you’re set apart—but what is it that you’re set apart for? Join Pastor Craig Groeschel on a journey to find your purpose and understand who you God made you to be.

NEXT STEPS

Have you made a decision to follow Jesus? You may be wondering what’s next on your journey. We want to help! Let us guide you to your next steps in your walk with Christ: https://www.life.church/next

WELCOME PASTOR JOAKIM LUNDQVIST

Pastor Joakim Lundqvist is Senior Pastor of Word of Life Church in Uppsala, Sweden, with 3,200 members and an international network including over 700 churches. Before stepping into the ministry of Senior Pastor at Word of Life, Pastor Joakim founded the Christian cross-denominational student organization New Generation in Sweden. His 30 years of experience in youth ministry shines through in his creative sermons, aiming to relate to every generation. 

He is married to Maria, who serves as Music Director at Word of Life, and they have two daughters, Evelina and Julia, who are also both involved in the church and ministry.

itunes.keywords: spirit of god, faith, how to share your faith, walking on water, joakim lundqvist, evangelist, steps of faith, word of life, lord, gospel, share your faith, power of holy spirit, how to share the gospel, evangelism, walk on water, holy spirit
itunes.subtitle: The power of the Holy Spirit is strong. Don’t let thunderstorms and crashing waves around you keep you from what God has in store for you. Every day, you’re given chances to grow, to connect, and to make a difference. Are you ready to Step Out of Your Boat into something greater? Join Pastor Joakim Lundqvist to see how the Holy Spirit isn’t just preparing you for something incredible—the power of the Holy Spirit is preparing others for it, too.
itunes.summary: The power of the Holy Spirit is strong. Don’t let thunderstorms and crashing waves around you keep you from what God has in store for you. Every day, you’re given chances to grow, to connect, and to make a difference. Are you ready to Step Out of Your Boat into something greater? Join Pastor Joakim Lundqvist to see how the Holy Spirit isn’t just preparing you for something incredible—the power of the Holy Spirit is preparing others for it, too.

items.content:
REOPENING

To ensure safety at all of our Life.Church locations, our weekend services have been redesigned to create a sanitary, touchless environment that allows for physical distancing. Learn more about everything we're doing to keep you safe and how you can help by using hand sanitizer, washing your hands often, and more:: https://www.life.church/updates

I’M GENEROUS

When you gave your life to God, you accepted the most generous gift of all. This four-day Bible Plan will help you discover the only rational response. Start reading the next Stay Positive Bible Plan, “I’m Generous”: https://www.go2.lc/staypositive

SUPPORT COVID-19 RESPONSE AND DIGITAL MISSIONS

You can designate a gift to Life.Church to go to coronavirus relief or to Digital Missions like the Church Online Platform! Your gift above the tithe helps meet immediate needs in your community and around the world and helps other churches to spread the Good News of Christ to people everywhere: https://www.life.church/giving

ABOUT STAY POSITIVE

There’s no limit on hope. You can discover a whole lot to smile about if you know where to look. And we can help you find it! Don’t let life get you down. Stay joyful. Stay hopeful. And Stay Positive! For more about this series, visit https://www.life.church/staypositive

STAY CONNECTED

Stay updated with the latest news from Life.Church at https://www.life.church/stayconnected. You can also visit https://www.life.church/updates for the latest, or download the Life.Church app (https://www.life.church/app) and enable push notifications.

itunes.subtitle: How do we inoculate ourselves against the scarcity mindset? How do we decide to live with the abundance mindset that reminds us God is more than enough? In this message, find out how to stop the scarcity cycle using three principles of provision and stay positive through faith in God.

ABOUT STAY POSITIVE

There’s no limit on hope. You can discover a whole lot to smile about if you know where to look. And we can help you find it! Don’t let life get you down. Stay joyful. Stay hopeful. And Stay Positive! For more about this series, visit https://www.life.church/staypositive

items.content:
ABOUT GOD, HELP US UNITE

When our world is divided and people are hurting, what’s our responsibility as followers of Christ? Where do we even start? Get next steps and follow-up resources for this series at https://go2.lc/stopracism

WANT TO KNOW WHAT THE BIBLE SAYS ABOUT RACIAL RECONCILIATION?

Check out these YouVersion Bible Plans:

-Tony Evans Explores Racial Reconciliation: https://www.bible.com/reading-plans/20082-tony-evans-explores-racial-reconciliation

-Rev. Dr. Bernice A. King: Cultivating a Heart of Mercy: https://www.bible.com/reading-plans/13890-bernice-king-cultivating-a-heart-of-mercy/

-Be The Bridge: By Latasha Morrison: https://www.bible.com/reading-plans/16910-the-bridge-a-5-day-youversion-by-latasha-morrison/

-Patterns for Peace: https://www.bible.com/reading-plans/17861-patterns-for-peace

MORE ON RACIAL RECONCILIATION:

-We Can Do Better to Stop Racism: https://finds.life.church/stop-racism/

-Racism is Real: https://finds.life.church/racism-real-martin-luther-king-jr-grandma/

-How I Learned to Live a Life That Matters from a Civil Rights Pioneer: https://finds.life.church/learned-live-life-matters-civil-rights-pioneer/

REOPENING

Some Life.Church locations have resumed services. To ensure safety at our locations, our weekend services have been redesigned to create a sanitary, touchless environment that allows for physical distancing. To see if your location is open and to save your seat at an upcoming service, please visit https://www.life.church/updates

I’M OPTIMISTIC

Optimism doesn’t depend on what we see—it stems from what God says. This four-day Bible Plan unwraps eight reasons from Romans 8 to remain unwaveringly optimistic. Start reading part one of the six-part Stay Positive series: https://www.go2.lc/staypositive

SUPPORT COVID-19 RESPONSE AND DIGITAL MISSIONS

itunes.author: Craig Groeschel
itunes.subtitle: Bad news seems to be everywhere you look these days. What consumes your mind controls your life—so who’s ready for some good news and positive thinking instead? In Week 1 of Stay Positive, join Pastor Craig Groeschel to discover the hope you can have in Christ, the good news you need to hear, and how to stay optimistic even when bad news tries to dominate your daily life.
itunes.summary: Bad news seems to be everywhere you look these days. What consumes your mind controls your life—so who’s ready for some good news and positive thinking instead? In Week 1 of Stay Positive, join Pastor Craig Groeschel to discover the hope you can have in Christ, the good news you need to hear, and how to stay optimistic even when bad news tries to dominate your daily life.

items.title: Stay Positive, Part 1: Enough of the Bad News

items.content:
STAY CONNECTED

Even when we can’t meet in our physical locations, we’re still doing church. Stay updated with the latest news from Life.Church at https://www.life.church/stayconnected. You can also visit https://www.life.church/updates for the latest, or download the Life.Church app (https://www.life.church/app) and enable push notifications.

SUPPORT COVID-19 RESPONSE AND DIGITAL MISSIONS

You can designate a gift to Life.Church to go to coronavirus relief or to Digital Missions like the Church Online Platform! Your gift above the tithe helps meet immediate needs in your community and around the world and helps other churches to spread the Good News of Christ to people everywhere: https://www.life.church/giving

 

DO CHURCH AT HOME

Churches in many countries are suspending regular in-person gatherings, but that doesn’t mean church is canceled. As followers of Jesus, we are the Church. Use this guide on having church at home to stay connected to your community: https://finds.life.church/church-at-home-guide/

LIFE.CHURCH MIDWEEK 

Life.Church is hosting special midweek services with worship and a short devotional with Pastor Craig Groeschel here on YouTube Live every Wednesday. Subscribe to our channel and tap the bell icon to be notified when we’re going live!

itunes.author: Craig Groeschel
itunes.keywords: stop comparing, compare your calling, comparison, find your purpose, comparing yourself to others, purpose, don't compare yourself to others, how to stop comparing yourself to others, comparisons, compare, comparing, how to stop comparing, stop comparing yourself to others
itunes.subtitle: Your purpose is yours alone. God created you to live out your unique calling. No one else can do it for you. And you can’t live out anyone else’s. Join Pastor Craig Groeschel to see how when you start to compare your calling with someone else’s, you might find yourself disappointed, discouraged, or disillusioned with your life.
itunes.summary: Your purpose is yours alone. God created you to live out your unique calling. No one else can do it for you. And you can’t live out anyone else’s. Join Pastor Craig Groeschel to see how when you start to compare your calling with someone else’s, you might find yourself disappointed, discouraged, or disillusioned with your life.

items.title: There Is a Reason, Part 3: Stop Comparing Your Calling

items.author: interactive@life.church (Craig Groeschel)
items.content:
STAY CONNECTED

Even when we can’t meet in our physical locations, we’re still doing church. Stay updated with the latest news from Life.Church at https://www.life.church/stayconnected. You can also visit https://www.life.church/updates for the latest, or download the Life.Church app (https://www.life.church/app) and enable push notifications.

SUPPORT COVID-19 RESPONSE AND DIGITAL MISSIONS

You can designate a gift to Life.Church to go to coronavirus relief or to Digital Missions like the Church Online Platform! Your gift above the tithe helps meet immediate needs in your community and around the world and helps other churches to spread the Good News of Christ to people everywhere: https://www.life.church/giving

 

DO CHURCH AT HOME

Churches in many countries are suspending regular in-person gatherings, but that doesn’t mean church is canceled. As followers of Jesus, we are the Church. Use this guide on having church at home to stay connected to your community: https://finds.life.church/church-at-home-guide/

LIFE.CHURCH MIDWEEK 

Life.Church is hosting special midweek services with worship and a short devotional with Pastor Craig Groeschel here on YouTube Live every Wednesday. Subscribe to our channel and tap the bell icon to be notified when we’re going live!

NEXT STEPS

Have you made a decision to follow Jesus? You may be wondering what’s next on your journey. We want to help! Let us guide you to your next steps in your walk with Christ: https://www.life.church/next

ABOUT LIFE.CHURCH

Wherever you are in life, you have a purpose. Life.Church wants to help you find your next step. Our hope is that your journey will include joining us at a Life.Church location throughout the United States or globally online at https://www.live.life.church. Find locations, videos, and more info about us at https://www.life.church or download the Life.Church app at https://www.life.church/app.

itunes.keywords: find purpose, how to find your why, the purpose of life, find why, what is my purpose, finding your purpose, find your why, find your purpose, purpose, purpose in life, the why, purpose of life, what is the purpose of life, god’s purpose, how to find purpose, life purpose
itunes.subtitle: God made you on purpose, for a purpose. There’s a “why” behind your “who.” If you’re ready to find your “why,” join Pastor Craig Groeschel for a powerful message about your purpose, your calling, and how to live out who you were made to be.
itunes.summary: God made you on purpose, for a purpose. There’s a “why” behind your “who.” If you’re ready to find your “why,” join Pastor Craig Groeschel for a powerful message about your purpose, your calling, and how to live out who you were made to be.

itunes.keywords: trials, hurt, purpose of pain in life, theres purpose in your pain, purpose in your pain, most painful, purpose in pain sermon, god’s purpose in our pain, purpose in my pain, purpose, gods purpose, romans 8, pain, purpose in pain, emotional pain, finding purpose in pain, painful
itunes.subtitle: When we’re going through trials, it’s tempting to look at our lives with a perspective of pain. But there’s a purpose in your pain. Join Pastor Craig Groeschel to see how God never wastes a hurt, and how He’s preparing you for something far greater through the trials, struggles, and pain you’re experiencing now.
itunes.summary: When we’re going through trials, it’s tempting to look at our lives with a perspective of pain. But there’s a purpose in your pain. Join Pastor Craig Groeschel to see how God never wastes a hurt, and how He’s preparing you for something far greater through the trials, struggles, and pain you’re experiencing now.

itunes.author: Craig Groeschel
itunes.keywords: easter story, he is risen, easter, matthew 26, in control, surrender control, life is out of control, out of control, illusion of control, easter sermon video, church online, god is in control, craig groeschel easter, easter sermon, resurrection, easter sermon 2020, easter message, easter sunday, crucifixion, easter 2020
itunes.subtitle:
One church. Thousands of locations. Let's gather together in our homes to celebrate life in Christ this Easter. 

As humans, we like to feel like we’re in control. We like to know what we can expect. But right now, we’re uncertain. We’re distant. Right now, life feels out of control. But maybe we never had it in the first place. In this special Easter message, Pastor Craig Groeschel will show you how we gain strength, peace, and courage when we surrender control of our lives to God. It won’t always be easy—but it will always be worth it.

itunes.subtitle: At this unprecedented time, people everywhere are searching for comfort, peace, or anxiety relief. If you’re stressed out, filled with fear, or panicked about what tomorrow may bring—there’s hope. There’s an answer. There’s good news. Join Pastor Craig Groeschel to discover what to do when anxiety attacks.

itunes.keywords: anxiety
itunes.subtitle: It’s OK to feel emotional right now. Anxiety, fear, and isolation might be trying to take over your heart, but God’s Word tells us in James that when we draw near to God, He draws near to us. If you’re feeling anxious, alone, or afraid and need to feel God closer to you, this video is for you. Listen to this hope-filled message from Pastor Craig Groeschel to discover God’s faithfulness, unfailing love, and promises for the future.

items.content:encodedSnippet:
STAY CONNECTED
Even when we can’t meet in our physical locations, we’re still doing church. Stay updated with the latest news from Life.Church at https://www.life.church/stayconnected. You can also visit https://www.life.church/updates for the latest, or download the Life.Church app (https://www.life.church/app) and enable push notifications.
DO CHURCH AT HOME
Churches in many countries are suspending regular in-person gatherings, but that doesn’t mean church is canceled. As followers of Jesus, we are the Church. Use this guide on having church at home to stay connected to your community: https://finds.life.church/church-at-home-guide/
MIDWEEK WORSHIP
During at least the next few weeks, Life.Church will host special midweek services with worship and a short devotional with Pastor Craig Groeschel here on YouTube Live. Subscribe to our channel and tap the bell icon to be notified when we’re going live!
ABOUT NOT AFRAID
When our world is shaken, it’s easy for fear to spread. But God promises to be with us no matter what comes our way. In times of uncertainty, it’s more important than ever to trust who God is and how He says we can live—Not Afraid. More: https://www.life.church/media/messages/not-afraid

itunes.author: Craig Groeschel
itunes.subtitle: Hope is contagious. When the fear of the unknown spreads, our hope in Christ can spread even faster. Replace panic with peace. Replace anxiety with comfort. Replace the “what-ifs” with faith in what God can do. Join Pastor Craig Groeschel for a special message to see how, in the face of coronavirus fears and isolation, we can have a contagious hope that fights back the fear of the unknown.
itunes.summary: Hope is contagious. When the fear of the unknown spreads, our hope in Christ can spread even faster. Replace panic with peace. Replace anxiety with comfort. Replace the “what-ifs” with faith in what God can do. Join Pastor Craig Groeschel for a special message to see how, in the face of coronavirus fears and isolation, we can have a contagious hope that fights back the fear of the unknown.

itunes.author: Craig Groeschel
itunes.keywords: how to overcome fear, gatherings, sound mind, fear, spirit of fear, coronavirus church, coronavirus response, craig groeschel coronavirus, life.church coronavirus
itunes.subtitle:
In the last two weeks Pastor Craig Groeschel has gained a unique perspective on the fear and anxiety related to the recent coronavirus outbreak. Hear what he's learned from his experience, and how God invites us to respond to the situation.

When our world is shaken, it’s easy for fear to spread. But God promises to be with us no matter what comes our way. In times of uncertainty, it’s more important than ever to trust who God is and how He says we can live—Not Afraid.
itunes.summary:
In the last two weeks Pastor Craig Groeschel has gained a unique perspective on the fear and anxiety related to the recent coronavirus outbreak. Hear what he's learned from his experience, and how God invites us to respond to the situation.

When our world is shaken, it’s easy for fear to spread. But God promises to be with us no matter what comes our way. In times of uncertainty, it’s more important than ever to trust who God is and how He says we can live—Not Afraid.

items.title: Not Afraid: How should the Church respond to coronavirus?

items.author: interactive@life.church (Robert Morris)
items.content:
THREE-MONTH TITHE CHALLENGE

Countless people experience God's blessings when they tithe, but often the first step is the hardest one to take. That’s why we created the Three-Month Tithe Challenge. Put God first in your finances for 90 days, and if you don’t experience His faithfulness, we will refund 100% of your tithe. Take the challenge at https://www.life.church/giving/challenge

NEXT STEPS

Have you made a decision to follow Jesus? You may be wondering what’s next on your journey. We want to help! Let us guide you to your next steps in your walk with Christ: http://www.life.church/next

ABOUT LIFE.CHURCH

Wherever you are in life, you have a purpose. Life.Church wants to help you find your next step. Our hope is that your journey will include joining us at a Life.Church location throughout the United States or globally online at https://www.live.life.church. Find locations, videos, and more info about us at https://www.life.church or download the Life.Church app at https://www.life.church/app. 

WELCOME PASTOR ROBERT MORRIS

Robert Morris is the founding lead senior pastor of Gateway Church, a multi-site church in the Dallas/Fort Worth area. Since it began in 2000, the church has grown to more than 71,000 active attenders. His television program is aired in over 190 countries, and his radio program, Worship & the Word with Pastor Robert, airs in more than 1,800 radio markets across America. He serves as chancellor of The King’s University and is the bestselling author of numerous books, including The Blessed Life, Frequency, Beyond Blessed, and Take the Day Off.

 

Robert and his wife, Debbie, have been married 39 years and are blessed with one married daughter, two married sons, and nine grandchildren. For more about Pastor Robert and his ministry, visit https://www.gatewaypeople.com.

itunes.author: Robert Morris
itunes.subtitle: When people think of generosity and tithing, we wonder how far that 10% can go. But sometimes it’s good if things don’t add up. When God is in the equation, we can end up with way more than we expected. Learn what can happen in our lives when we shift our thinking and start to multiply what He’s given us.
itunes.summary: When people think of generosity and tithing, we wonder how far that 10% can go. But sometimes it’s good if things don’t add up. When God is in the equation, we can end up with way more than we expected. Learn what can happen in our lives when we shift our thinking and start to multiply what He’s given us.

itunes.subtitle: First Things First is a pretty good way to live … unless you don’t know what that first thing is. If you’ve found yourself focusing more on what matters less, you’re not alone. Join Pastor Robert Morris as we discover how to put what's important on top of our priority lists.
itunes.summary: First Things First is a pretty good way to live … unless you don’t know what that first thing is. If you’ve found yourself focusing more on what matters less, you’re not alone. Join Pastor Robert Morris as we discover how to put what's important on top of our priority lists.

items.title: First Things First, Part 1: The Principle of First

items.author: interactive@life.church (Craig Groeschel)
items.content:
JOIN A LIFEGROUP

Find the community you’ve been looking for. Discover the prayer warriors waiting to stand with you. If you’re interested in joining or starting a LifeGroup, visit https://www.life.church/lifegroups.

 

PRAYERS FOR WHAT YOU NEED

Whether you’re new to prayer or have been praying your whole life, it can sometimes feel overwhelming figuring out where to begin. We’ve put together some resources that may help you discover why we pray, how you can pray, and some prayers for strength, hope, stress, and everything else you need. Read through our prayer guide, available here: https://finds.life.church/prayers-for-strength/

 

NEXT STEPS

Have you made a decision to follow Jesus? You may be wondering what’s next on your journey. We want to help! Let us guide you to your next steps in your walk with Christ: https://www.life.church/next

 

PRAY WITH FIRE

Prayer moves the heart of God, but some prayers move Him more than others do. Bold prayers, daring prayers—the kind of prayers that move you, too. If you’re ready to see God work in your life, praying safe won’t cut it. It’s time to pray Dangerous Prayers. Find more from our Dangerous Prayers series here: https://www.life.church/dangerousprayers

 

MORE FROM DANGEROUS PRAYERS

Find even more ways to strengthen your prayer life. You can check out Pastor Craig’s new book, Dangerous Prayers, available here: https://www.amazon.com/Dangerous-Prayers-Because-Following-Jesus/dp/0310343127   

 

ABOUT LIFE.CHURCH

Wherever you are in life, you have a purpose. Life.Church wants to help you find your next step. Our hope is that your journey will include joining us at a Life.Church location throughout the United States or globally online at https://www.live.life.church. Find locations, videos, and more info about us at https://www.life.church or download the Life.Church app at https://www.life.church/app. 

 

FIND US ON SOCIAL MEDIA

Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/life.church

Instagram: http://www.instagram.com/life.church

Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/lifechurch

 

CONNECT WITH PASTOR CRAIG

YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCIIdiIO-Y20hRW9niR0CA8A

Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/craiggroeschel

Instagram: http://www.instagram.com/craiggroeschel

Twitter: 

http://www.twitter.com/craiggroeschel

itunes.author: Craig Groeschel
itunes.keywords: break my heart, hurt with a purpose, jeremiah 8 sermon, jeremiah 8, heart of god, jeremiah 8 18-22, jeremiah 8:18, nehemiah, powerful prayer, powerful prayers, david, moses, praying
itunes.subtitle: The thought of asking God to break your heart might sound a bit dangerous—and that’s because it is. In this message, Pastor Craig Groeschel introduces a prayer meant to align your heart with God’s, so you can begin to live in His truth and righteousness. Find out why asking God to break your heart could change your life forever.
itunes.summary: The thought of asking God to break your heart might sound a bit dangerous—and that’s because it is. In this message, Pastor Craig Groeschel introduces a prayer meant to align your heart with God’s, so you can begin to live in His truth and righteousness. Find out why asking God to break your heart could change your life forever.

items.title: Dangerous Prayers, Part 3: The Most Dangerous Prayer: Break My Heart

itunes.author: Craig Groeschel
itunes.keywords: dangerous prayers
itunes.subtitle: It’s hard to hear from God when you don’t know what to listen for, especially if you find yourself praying with caution. But He’s ready for you to give Him your boldest prayers, and wants you to understand what He has to say. In this message, join Pastor Craig Groeschel to discover how to clear your mind and prepare your heart so you can be ready to hear from God.
itunes.summary: It’s hard to hear from God when you don’t know what to listen for, especially if you find yourself praying with caution. itunes.author: Craig Groeschel
itunes.keywords: bold, dangerous prayers, be bold, powerful prayer, powerful prayers, prayer is powerful, boldness, how to pray, praying bold prayers, bold prayers, praying, praying bold prayers, acts 4, act of boldness, make me bold, acts 5, praying makes me anxious, praying makes me uneasy
itunes.subtitle: When you talk to God, are you boldly bringing Him powerful prayers or are you stuck in a rut of praying it safe? In this week's message, Pastor Craig Groeschel brings to light how to break common prayer habits and begin talking to God with confidence and courage. Find out how God empowers you to take hold of the bravery you need to renew your faith and start praying powerful prayers.
itunes.summary: When you talk to God, are you boldly bringing Him powerful prayers or are you stuck in a rut of praying it safe? Find out how God empowers you to take hold of the bravery you need to renew your faith and start praying powerful prayers.

Men: You don’t have to fight your battles alone. Life is better together! LifeGroups are a place to laugh, grow, and serve with friends. If you’re interested in a LifeGroup, head to https://www.life.church/lifegroups to get started.

LET PASTOR CRAIG LEAD YOUR LIFEGROUP

Going through Warrior with your men’s LifeGroup? Pastor Craig has created discussion videos you can use to spark conversation and grow closer together. Find them each week of the series: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLXvTERtQ_HV95I1zWGNn02-92iCSQXOo8

WHAT ARE YOU FIGHTING FOR?

Defeat the fear that stares you down. Find purpose in your battles. Discover your God-given courage to become the Warrior He made you to be. Get more from the Warrior message series: https://www.life.church/warrior

NEXT STEPS

Have you made a decision to follow Jesus? You may be wondering what’s next on your journey. We want to help! Let us guide you to your next steps in your walk with Christ: http://www.life.church/next

itunes.author: Craig Groeschel
itunes.keywords: father wound, father son bond, father son relationships, father and son, mother daughter bond, what every warrior needs to hear, mother daughter relationship, wounded warrior
itunes.subtitle: When you wrestle with letting go of the past, leaving behind the pain of rejection seems impossible. We’re all wounded warriors, and often those wounds were given by the people we love. But God wants to give you the freedom you’ve been looking for. Join Pastor Craig Groeschel for this week’s message, and discover how you can finally let go of the past and step into the healing God has for you.
itunes.summary: When you wrestle with letting go of the past, leaving behind the pain of rejection seems impossible. We’re all wounded warriors, and often those wounds were given by the people we love. But God wants to give you the freedom you’ve been looking for. Join Pastor Craig Groeschel for this week’s message, and discover how you can finally let go of the past and step into the healing God has for you.

itunes.author: Sermon
itunes.keywords: how to avoid porn, stop porn, how to quit porn, lust, sexual sin, pornography, how to stop watching porn, my first experience with porn, how to stop porn addiction, how to overcome porn addiction, is porn a sin, porn, temptation, quit porn
itunes.subtitle: Sexual sin often leads to shame, guilt, and pain—but you don’t have to give in. It’s time to stand up and fight lust, adultery, and porn. In this message, Pastor Craig Groeschel will help you understand why sexual sin is so easily draws us in, why we can’t allow it to keep its hold on us, and a five-step plan to defeat temptation and overcome the sexual sin that tries to control us.
itunes.summary: Sexual sin often leads to shame, guilt, and pain—but you don’t have to give in. It’s time to stand up and fight lust, adultery, and porn. In this message, Pastor Craig Groeschel will help you understand why sexual sin is so easily draws us in, why we can’t allow it to keep its hold on us, and a five-step plan to defeat temptation and overcome the sexual sin that tries to control us.

itunes.subtitle: It’s time to fight your fear of failure and begin living a life without regrets. Self-doubt doesn’t have the power to hold you back. itunes.author: Craig Groeschel
itunes.keywords: heart of a warrior, be a man, what does it mean to be a man, passionate, throw a punch, fight, life.church sermons, what it means to be a man, living word, exodus, warrior
itunes.subtitle:
You’re a warrior. You’ve got something to fight for. You have someone to protect. You’ve got a kingdom to advance. You’ve got an enemy to conquer. When it’s time to throw a punch, what does a true warrior do? Join Pastor Craig Groeschel to gain wisdom and understanding from God’s Word as you fight your battles. You’re a warrior—it’s time to step into your calling.

MEN: JOIN OR LEAD A WARRIOR LIFEGROUP
